B-24D  41-24138   14AF 308BG 373BS

Standing, L-R:  1Lt Roy E. Tooman - Pilot, 2Lt Robert E. Hairston - Co-Pilot, 2Lt Marvin J. Silvershatz - Navigator, 2Lt James F. Nolan - Bombardier

Kneeling, L-R: Sgt Charles B. Hertzberg - Asst Engineer, Cpl Deno Renieri - Gunner, SSgt James L. Whited - Engineer, Sgt George C. Little - Asst Radio Operator, SSgt Robert T. Tertell - Radio Operator

One of the earliest radar equipped B-24s in China (possibly the first), Axis Nightmare sank a 550 ft - 21,000 ton Japanese Navy destroyer on 19-Aug-1944 [with a different flight crew].  It is also credited with sinking two additional Japanese Navy vessels, and the converted Italian liner "Conte Verde."
